item.title: OpenAI prepares new open weight models along with GPT-5
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI isn't just working on GPT-5. It looks like OpenAI is also preparing to release new open-source weights, living up to its name,Â OpenAI.' [...]

item.title: Anthropic says OpenAI engineers using Claude Code ahead of GPT-5 launch
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Anthropic says it has revoked OpenAI's access to the Claude API after ChatGPT's engineers were found using Claude's coding tools. [...]

item.title: OpenAI may be testing a cheaper paid plan for ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is reportedly working on a new plan called 'Go,' which would be cheaper than the existing $20 Plus subscription. [...]

item.title: SonicWall firewall devices hit in surge of Akira ransomware attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: SonicWall firewall devices have been increasingly targeted since late July in a surge of Akira ransomware attacks, potentially exploiting a previously unknown security vulnerability, according to cybersecurity company Arctic Wolf. [...]

item.title: Pi-hole discloses data breach triggered by WordPress plugin flaw
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Pi-hole, a popular network-level ad-blocker, has disclosed that donor names and email addresses were exposed through a security vulnerability in the GiveWP WordPress donation plugin. [...]

item.title: AI-powered Cursor IDE vulnerable to prompt-injection attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: A vulnerability that researchers call CurXecute is present in almost all versions of the AI-powered code editor Cursor, and can be exploited to execute remote code with developer privileges. [...]

item.title: Pwn2Own hacking contest pays $1 million for WhatsApp exploit
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Zero Day Initiative is offering a $1 million reward to security researchers who will demonstrate a zero-click WhatsApp exploit at its upcoming Pwn2Own Ireland 2025 hacking contest. [...]

item.title: Kali Linux can now run in Apple containers on macOS systems
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Cybersecurity professionals and researchers can now launch Kali Linux in a virtualized container on macOS Sequoia using Apple's new containerization framework. [...]

item.title: Microsoft to disable Excel workbook links to blocked file types
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has announced that it will start disabling external workbook links to blocked file types by default between October 2025 and July 2026. [...]

item.title: Microsoft now pays up to $40,000 for some .NET vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has expanded its .NET bug bounty program and increased rewards to $40,000 for some .NET and ASP.NET Core vulnerabilities. [...]

item.title: CISA open-sources Thorium platform for malware, forensic analysis
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) today announced the public availability of Thorium, an open-source platform for malware and forensic analysts across the government, public, and private sectors. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Russian hackers use ISP access to hack embassies in AiTM attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft warns that a cyber-espionage group linked to Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) is targeting diplomatic missions in Moscow using local internet service providers. [...]

item.title: Inside a Real Clickfix Attack: How This Social Engineering Hack Unfolds
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Keep Aware
item.description: ClickFix abuses clipboards. FileFix hijacks File Explorer. Both social engineering attacks start in the browserâand end in malware. See how Keep Aware stops these stealthy attacks before they break out of the browser in a run down of a real attack. [...]

item.title: Spikes in malicious activity precede new security flaws in 80% of cases
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Researchers have found that in roughly 80% of cases, spikes in malicious activity like network reconnaissance, targeted scanning, and brute-forcing attempts targeting edge networking devices are a precursor to the disclosure of new security vulnerabilities (CVEs) within six weeks. [...]
